ratings.comment: He writes out the notes by hand which can be pretty boring but keeps you engaged and you don't miss anything. He cracks a few funny jokes here and there.

I went into Calc with a skewed view of what Math would be like at the college level. I was nervous that a class like this would be impossible to receive an A in, but I couldn't have been more wrong . Tete is far and away the best prof I've had at Madison thus far. Further, he made me question switching my major entirely from economics to Mathmatics

Tete is SUPER thorough. He is very sweet too, and so so approachable. He was so patient - he had no problem reviewing the algebra behind some problems or even precalc which most professors would probably just expect you to know by that point. I love Tete because he is really humble too. Finally, I think his tests were really fair.

WORST TEACHER YOU WILL EVER HAVE CLASS IS SO UNORGANIZED ITS AMAZING. heared a TA telling a student that he didn't know if the final (1 week from that day) was cumulative. TA couldn't teach, couldn't tell me why my work was wrong. Often lost points for not doing something we weren't told to do. Horrible person, takes pleasure in being yelling at u

Math 321 is not for the faint of heart. Quizzes and exams are similar to homework but can still be challenging. Tete is a very good teacher though. He makes a notoriously difficult class easier to digest.

Worst professor I've had here. You need to know random factsequations that aren't mentioned in class for the tests and quizzes and don't expect partial credit. He's a terrible grader and he's pretty mean to the class too.

Tete is always in the happiest mood! Lectures can be boring and he spends a lot of time proving proofs and the examples he shows are way easier than the homework. Generous with test curves and extra credit helps. TA's helpful and recommend going to review sessions before exams. Questions on tests can be confusing, but come from homework problems.

Tete is probably used to teaching people who are better at math than students in this class. He is already a very good teacher and will become even better now that he knows his audience. Go to class, work hard, and you will be OK.

Tete was a sweet guy but his lectures made no sense.  He spent most of his time proving things instead of showing us how to do problems.  Discussion was super helpful and the TAs held really good review sessions before exams.  Homework is optional but you should do it if you want to do well

He goes by Tete-- super easy going and passionate about the material. Extends office hours around test times. Tests are tough and sometimes hard to know what the question is asking. Writes all the notes on the blackboard so going to class is a must if you want the notes.

I've never taken calc and had zero interest in it if I didn't have to take it. But he was a fantastic professor because he really laid out the concepts for you in lecture. His tests can be really tough, but if you go to lecture and understand the concepts, you'll understand how he takes hw questions and twists them around a little bit. Good prof.

Lectures: Fun &  entertaining. Learn a lot. Thorough. Seems slow if you understand material. Does proofs a lot.  Exams: Both midterms were fair. Study more than you think you should and you'll easily get A's. Generous curves. Final was unnecessarily tricky, but fair nonetheless. Personality: Very funny. Lovable accent. Favorite professor easily.

This was Tete's first semester teaching Calc 211 (business calc) and it showed. He spent the majority of his lectures proving the calculus instead of teaching the calculus which left the actual information up to the TAs and the students themselves to be taught. Otherwise, very smart and helpful if you ask for it. Knows what he's talking about.

He is  a very funny teach who explains the material well... That being said he goes into proofs during class that really can confuse you, also you do not need them for the test. The tests are curved graciously but they are tough, you will work until the end. He is a great and friendly professor!

Tete is one of the best math profs I have ever had. His explanations of concepts are explained in a crystal clear manner and he has the most beautiful handwriting ever. His exams are definitely challenging. Whatever you do, ALWAYS do the hw thoroughly. That's the best way to do well in his class. And never skip class or you'll fall behind.
hard
Tete is great and the class is kinda hard, but not too bad

Tete is a good professor and is easy to understand; however, he does many confusing proofs during lecture and wastes some time that could be used to do more helpful examples.  Overall, he is good, but the tests are much more difficult than homework and review questions.
Honestly the best professor I've had at UW-Madison!

Tete's a funny guy and is very passionate about math. However, he spends too much lecture time performing complicated proofs that aren't necessary to our understanding of the material. The proofs just confuse the students (who are mostly business majors meeting a requirement), and would be better spent on other examples. I do a lot of self-teaching
Tete is a great teacher. I'm just bad at math

Tete is a great teacher; he understands how to empathize and adjust his practices as needed. He does not generally give required homework, but he assigns optional homework which is used to study for quizzes. an Accent is present, but his English is superb. I've had him twice now and would recommend him.

Overall Tete is a very clear professor, he presents material very clearly and he even adds a few funny jokes. He presents his lecture without any notes, which is quite impressive. HW is not collected, quizzes make up a large part of your grade. Exams are difficult but he gives out practice exams which are very similar to the actual exam.

Anakewit Boonkasame aka "Tete" is probably the best math professor I have ever had in my life. He has a thick accent but can speak English extremely well. Has a great sense of humor. His exams are extremely tough, but you WILL definitely learn the material by taking this course. Homework is optional and no solutions avail, and weekly quizzes. Hard.

One of the best math professors at UW. Lectures are a real treat due to his fluidity and clarity. Homework is tough and there are no published solutions, but he is helpful and patient in office hours. His exams can be very difficult, but if you do the homework, you will be fine. You will definitely know vector calculus after this class.

Tete is a great professor that comes to lecture each day prepared to teach. His examples are extremely helpful. The best math professor I've ever had. Very funny and nice guy as well, and is very helpful in office hours. His tests are challenging but it is because he expects the students to know the material so well due to his in class examples
Best professor I've ever had
Systematic, clear, and concise. He is not going to be easy but you will learn a lot. Tete is a good professor overall.

He is extremely passionate about what he teaches. He really wants to make sure you understand everything. He gives you the link to his old exams which are almost identical to the exams he gives. Homework isn't necessary and he has a very lenient curve with a B average. I would definitely recommend Tete if you have to take this class! :)

Tete was a great professor! He kept things interesting with the occasional joke and was a great person in general. The course itself was very tough and the "course packet" that took the place of a textbook was of no help at all. The practice test provided are very similar to the tests given. Overall good experience though.

Tete is the greatest thing to happen to me. He has inspired me to be the person I have become. Ive been on my knees a lot for him, but it was all worth it at the office hours. I love you TETE! Saddle up!

Once you get used to his accent, he speaks very good english so don't worry about first that too much. He's pretty good at explaining concepts, but expects you to do work outside of class to pass his tests. I don't personally approve of the fact that he does seemingly unnecessary proofs, but this is standard in a college calculus course.

Tete was a very good professor. I learned a lot in his class and I felt that overall his class and tests were fair to the students. He adds some jokes into lecture to help lighten the mood too. The difficulty of the class was just because of the information was different. Tete is a good professor though.
Tete is the best teacher ever. Trust me, if you write all class notes, study those, and take the practice exams, you will have a great time. He is so hilarious as well. Love you Tete!

Tete did have a good sense of humor, but what impressed me most was he gave clear and interesting lectures without ever using notes. His handwriting and drawing were out of this world. Go for the jokes, stay for the math!

Tete is a really great professor. Always has some funny joke to end class with, is very passionate about what he does, and is there to help you at any time! If you do (some) of the homework, study his old exams, and go to lecture, you should get a good grade.

Hes the best math teacher I have ever seen. His lecture is like art and never got you sleepy. Many people complain his exams are too hard but actually they are not if you really have a good background of cal 1 and 2. And exams are pretty similar to practice exams. SO take it easy and feel free to choose him. You will be happy I promise!!
Overall Tete's a good prof

What a great guy! Tete is a quirky individual, and can always get a laugh from his nerdy sense of humor. Accent is present, but not overwhelming. Tests are difficult, but if you pay attention, and do the suggested (not required) homework, you should be ok.

I took four math classes last year and I enjoyed Tete's the most. I really appreciated him relating mathematical concepts to physical ideas and making the class interesting. His exams were not easy but you will be fine if you pay attention in lecture and do homework. I recommend taking his class if you have a chance.

Tete is a great professor. He is a genius mathematician. I honestly hated math before I took this class and his very approachable attitude along with interesting remarks makes the subject fascinating. His grading is harsh, but fair. I recommend going to office hours and getting to know him, the supplemental conversations will fill in all the blanks

Tete is a gentle but firm person. I wouldn't be surprised if he put a few people in their place when they were out of line (hence a few disgruntled students). He is always patient, never condescending, when answering questions. I have great respect for him because he looks out for honest and hard-working students and he is a really good teacher.

Tete seems like a nice guy and his lectures are well organized and he explains topics well. He is a fair grader and has the students best interests in mind. Be forewarned that his exams are not easy and some of the material can be challenging. If you do the hw and go to class you should be fine though.

Hard class, decent professor. I didn't do as well as I would have hoped, but I also should have done more homework. Do the homework and you should be fine in the class. Exams and quizzes in discussion were a pain, but lectures weren't bad. I liked that he lectured without notes.

Our final exam was canceled due to a winter storm and the prof had to come up with alternative final grades for us. Many people and I lucked out because his final exam (like his midterm exams) would not have been easy. To be fair, his exams were based on his lecture and homework, and he's a superb teacher.

Wonderful, sympathetic professor. He has an original sense of humor and knows how to teach the murkiest parts of the Math 234 textbook. He grades on a curve but the curve is lenient. One thing he is really good at doing - making math relevant by making connections. I like the "Your job is done but here's the significance of what you just found."

Tete is one of the few good professors in the UW math dept. His lectures are a good replacement for the book, but you still need the textbook to study as his exams can be very difficult. There are usually just 5 problems on the exam, but it's a challenge to finish on time. Time will be your worst enemy on his exams.

Tete!!! Cancel the finals and make a lot of options for us! WITHOUT a final and receive an A!!! And he is the best teaching professor for Math234. This course is very hard and the other professor cannot explain as well as he did. I learnt a lot from him!!! THX, Tete!!! Thx, an easy A

Tete is the man enough said. hes actually hilarious and always cracks me up. Hes a genius and doesnt even use notes when he lectures. Lectures are very mandatory since exams are mostly rewrites of lecture problems. If you do homework and attend lecture you will do fine!

The grading system in this class is just awful.  80% of the final grade is based on exams. (about 25 problems total)  They grade exams wayyyy to harshly.  He spends most of the lecture on proofs that have nothing to do with the exams.  He's a nice guy and all but not a good professor

He is a good professor, a nice guy, his lectures are clear and helpful, handwriting is good, examples from lecture can be used to study for exam. Exams are straightforward, but hard if you don't know concepts.

I've had a few math classes at UW and he's by far my most favorite professor. His lecture is clear and you never have to read the textbook. (It's amazing how he never looks at his notes. I don't even know if he has written notes.) He's the only professor I know who has Saturday office hours.

Whether you should take his class depends on the type of student that you are. If you have a self-esteem issue and can only handle easy classes, then he's not for you. However, if you want to learn the material from someone who knows his stuff, explains it well, and is willing to help you understand it, then he's your man.

Tete is a very nice and respectful teacher. His exams are tough and you need to study a lot for them. You need to put the effort in to receive the grade you want to get. Thats basically it. Do the homework and go to lecture.
YES, condescending.  Would recommend another professor if you have that option.

Very condescending, expects you to do half the learning outside of class when he sends you emails, gets corrected by his students frequently, for whatever reason he spends more time on things he ends up telling you that you will not need to know then to catch up speeds through important stuff...
He is very knowledgeable and makes difficult concepts easier to understand. You will learn a great deal from his class, but you will have to work hard to earn a good grade.

Very nice person and good teacher! One of my favorite professors I have had in awhile. Make sure you go to every lecture because his notes are very helpful and most of the test problems will be similar to the examples he gives in class. Even though this is true, study hard for the exams because they are quite difficult and the grading isnt generous

I don't know what some people are talking about. His exams are similar to his examples and homework. I'm not a math wiz, but I'm getting an AB in his class. He teaches very well and is always helpful.

Not a good professor. Very hard exams and very harsh grading. The curb Got an A and an AB in Math 221 and 222 and will probably get a C or BC in 234. Comes across as VERY condescending (particularly in his emails).

Expects too much from his students and then blames them for poor exam performance.  While his exams are very similar to homework, they are similar and harder than the hard homework problems.  His exams are given in class, so you have 50 minutes to work five hard homework problems.  After getting A's in 221 and 222 I'm going to get a BC in Math 234!

His accent can be sort of weird at times, but he generally makes the textbook material seem much easier than it is. He makes occasional jokes that are somewhat funny, so he's not really monotone. Overall he's a good professor to have, very nice and has easy-to-follow lectures. He grades harshly? Not a chance. Maybe it's just the TA.
He's fairly easy to understand and is extremely helpful. Also, he explains everything thoroughly.  Overall, he is a top notch math professor.
very tough grading, doesn't teach material well
